intro: Zehneria elbertii, commonly known as the African violet, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often forming a rosette of leaves with a central stem that bears the inflorescence. Its flowers are usually brightly colored, ranging from white to pink and purple, and are pollinated by insects. Zehneria elbertii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
